issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

iPod (4.1) with mobile sdk build 1.4.2.e6bd67

1.Phone>Record video, record a short video in portrait. The tap play movie and view
2.back out a level, then tap into the record video test case again.
3.Tap "record Movie" then switch to landscape orientation and start the recording
4,stop and play back

results:Mon Sep 27 12:02:05 unknown /var/mobile/Applications/B6DFF6C6-4120-4FD2-9E39-69269B4F077A/KitchenSink.app/KitchenSink[205] : open on /var/mobile/Applications/B6DFF6C6-4120-4FD2-9E39-69269B4F077A/Documents/mymovie.mov: File exists

the new movie does not play, the previous does. A little intermittant, but reliably repro with a few attempts.

Also seen in 1.4.0

{html}
fields.summary: iOS: new video fails to overwrite existing ("File exists") when the second video is taken in landscape orientation.

comments.body: Latest KitchenSink doesn't seem to have a 'record video' option. Tested on a Samsung Galaxy S2 using TiSDK 2.2.0v20120821095711, unable to reproduce the issue. Ticket marked as resolved.
Closing ticket as we no longer support this version of Kitchen Sink.
